{"step_by_step_thinking": "Extra-embryonic mesoderm is a type of tissue that arises during the development of an embryo. According to Document [0], extra-embryonic mesoderm is derived at the time of gastrulation from the primitive streak. Document [3] further explains that the primitive streak is formed by the movement of epiblastic mesenchymal cells, which are cells that move into the body stalk to help form extraembryonic mesoderm. Therefore, the extra-embryonic mesoderm is derived from the epiblast.", "answer_choice": "A"}
